definition: lit. an old cow eats young grass (idiom)/fig. a May-December relationship/a romance where the man is significantly older than the woman

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to act young/to affect a youthful appearance
to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
mistress/the other woman (coll.)/grade 3 in elementary school
fig. romantic relationship between an elderly couple/falling in love in the autumn of one's life
lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
(Tw) naive and innocent (girl or boy)/underage prostitute/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [iù-khí])
to live off a rich man
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
